description:
Samoa declares a State of Emergency in response to the Coronavirus on March 20. On May 13, penalties for order violations were changed to fines from $2,000 to $10,000 and imprisonment up to 12 months in Samoa. This is an update to a previous update on March 30 where
the government of Samoa implemented some lesser fines and jail time for violations of state of emergency orders. UPDATE: On May 13, penalties for order violations were specified as fines from $2,000 to $10,000 and imprisonment up to 12 months in Samoa.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On May 30 2020 Samoa declared updated guidelines for fishing boats docking in Samoa including: fishing boats approved for offloading, refueling and the restock of necessary supplies only; (a) a maximum of 2 boats may dock in a day; and
   (b) medical and quarantine requirements are to be complied with;
   (c) no crew member is to leave the boat;
   (d) boat schedules must be submitted to the Samoa Ports Authority (SPA); Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF); Ministry of Police and Prisons Services (MOPPS) and the Ministry of Health (MOH); and
   (e) the date of departure from the last port, or the exchange of any crew members whilst at sea, must not be less than 28 days, before arrival at Apia wharf; and
   (f) notification of arrival date must be received by the relevant authorities (MAF and SPA) 5 days prior; and
   (g) there shall be no exchange of crew members whilst as sea.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On June 22 2020, Samoa released travel guidelines for passengers entering form New Zealand. 
Travelers from New Zealand
All are required to complete the Health Declaration Card in flight.
All are required to have a COVID-19 test done within three days before arrival
All are required to undergo medical examination by a Registered Medical Practitioner within (3) days before ARRIVAL.
All are required to present a hard copy of COVID19 test and medical report on arrival to health officers
quarantined for 14 days upon arrival into Samoa at a designated location.
required to wear a face mask at all times and advised to maintain social distancing in flight.
All TRAVELLERS OUTSIDE OF NEW ZEALAND MUST SPEND 28 DAYS OR MORE IN NEW ZEALAND BEFORE ONWARD TRAVEL TO SAMOA AND MUST COMPLY WITH ALL REQUIREMENTS.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On June 24 2020 Samoa updated its fishing boats policy to include: (a) may dock at Matautu Wharf for not more than 48 hours for the offloading of fish and restocking of the supplies before leaving Samoa; and
(b) medical and quarantine requirements are to be complied with; and
(c) no crew member is to leave the boat; and
(d) boat schedules must be submitted to the Samoa Ports Authority (SPA); Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF); Ministry of Police and Prisons Services (MOPPS) and the Ministry of Health (MOH); and
(e) the date of departure from the last port, or the exchange of any crew members whilst at sea, must not be less than 28 days, before arrival at Apia wharf; and
(f) notification of arrival date must be received by the relevant authorities (MAF and SPA) 5 days prior; and
(g) there shall be no exchange of crew members whilst as sea.
(5) For trade boats, a maximum of 2 trade boats are permitted to be docked at Matautu Wharf at one time and must meet safety requirements set by Samoa Ports Authority and other relevant Government entities.
(6) The Ministry of Health is to continue with the approved medical clearance of all involved.
(7) Travelling conditions permitted under subclause (2)(c) cease once American Samoa opens its borders for travel to and from Hawaii.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The lockdown in Samoa began on March 25 and is extended until April 12. With the extension, markets and mobile vendors are allowed to sell agricultural and fishery items, and inter-island marine transport can resume between Ha'apai, Vava'u, and the Niuas.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In the original declaration of emergency, Samoa banned street vendors on March 20.
(1) There shall be no selling of any goods beside roads, street, culverts or footpaths.
(2) Children selling goods in public is strictly prohibited.
On March 8 Samoa updated the ban on street vendors to list specific areas where they are banned: There shall be no selling of any goods beside roads, street, culverts, street islands or footpaths in the town areas of Apia, beginning from Mulinuu to Fugalei, Taufusi, Motootua, Matautu Tai and Savalalo. UPDATE: On March 8 Samoa updated the ban on street vendors to list specific areas where they are banned: There shall be no selling of any goods beside roads, street, culverts, street islands or footpaths in the town areas of Apia, beginning from Mulinuu to Fugalei, Taufusi, Motootua, Matautu Tai and Savalalo.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: Samoa banned street vendors and children selling on the street.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
